DOC.brief_title: Comparison Lifestyle Markers Between Women With Without Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: Polycystic ovary syndrome ( PCOS ) endocrine disorder affect 6-12 % reproductive-aged woman within general population . Currently , limit knowledge current lifestyle woman PCOS psychosocial factor associate PCOS . The researcher plan examine potential lifestyle difference psychosocial factor PCOS healthy woman . The Research Team also interest relationship biological marker lifestyle endpoint woman without PCOS . Previous literature show biological marker difference without PCOS . By examine relationship , researcher may understand whether PCOS status associate lifestyle parameter . To accomplish objective , 80 woman ( 40 woman PCOS , 40 woman without PCOS ) include study . Women include PCOS group confirm PCOS diagnosis primary care provider . Participants complete food frequency questionnaire physical activity questionnaire . A researcher may also provide participant accelerometer wear week . Ultrasound scans ovary assess follow metabolic parameter assess : ( 1 ) 75-gram oral glucose tolerance test ; ( 2 ) dual X-ray absorptiometry ( DXA ) scan ; ( 3 ) vitals anthropometry assessment measure waist hip circumference , height , weight , blood pressure , heart rate , ( 4 ) fast blood test detect androgen ( i.e. , total testosterone , androstenedione , free androgen index ) . Women without PCOS also ask complete questionnaire assess psychosocial factor ( e.g. , health belief ) . This conducted online , person , phone .
